channel.itunes:summary: You know that real life change takes Christ. But all of us need practical guidance on finding, learning, and applying the truths in the Bible that really transform. Join Pastor Blunt twice each week to explore the Bible together, focusing on the truths of scripture that really can change your life. Pastor Blunt pastors Church On The Rock in St. Peters, MO. Visit COTR online at http://cotr.org/
channel.title: Church On The Rock Video Podcast
channel.description: Welcome to Church on the Rock's video podcast Pastor David Blunt shares practical ways to apply Bible principles to our daily life. We believe that by understanding His Word, you and your family will live out God's purpose for your life. You can visit our website for more information cotr.org.
channel.itunes:author: Church On The Rock
channel.itunes:subtitle: Video Podcast

item.title: Church On The Rock Is - Part 3
item.itunes:title: Church On The Rock Is - Part 3
item.itunes:summary:
How to Grow Spiritually & Succeed in Life
Did you know that 50% of high school graduates never read another book from cover to cover? Many see learning as just a stage of life, but at Church on the Rock, we believe growth is a way of life!
In Part 3 of our series Church on the Rock Is, Daniel Blunt shares a powerful teaching on four ways we can grow spiritually and practical steps to apply growth principles in every area of life. Spiritual growth doesn’t happen automatically—it’s a choice! Are you ready to take the next step?
Watch now and be encouraged to grow in your faith, mindset, and purpose!
Plan your visit today to visit Church on the Rock in St. Peter’s, Missouri, located just 20 minutes away from St. Louis. cotr.org/planyourvisit.

item.title: God Worshipers - Part 2 - What It Really Means to Be a God Worshiper
item.itunes:title: God Worshipers - Part 2 - What It Really Means to Be a God Worshiper
item.itunes:summary:
Worship is more than just singing; it’s a lifestyle that aligns every part of our life with God’s purpose. In Part 2 of the God Worshipers series, Pastor Blunt dives deeper into what it truly means to live as a worshiper. Discover how worship shapes your thoughts, decisions, and actions, helping you hit God’s bullseye for your life.
Learn how saying “no” to your desires and “yes” to God is an act of worship, and why renewing your mind is the first step in living a life of authentic worship. Don’t miss this powerful message filled with practical insights to help you grow as a God Worshiper!
Plan your visit today to visit Church on the Rock in St. Peter’s, Missouri, located just 20 minutes away from St. Louis. cotr.org/planyourvisit

item.title: The Most Important Thing - The Most Important Thing to Thrive in 2025
item.itunes:title: The Most Important Thing - The Most Important Thing to Thrive in 2025
item.itunes:summary:
What’s the most important thing in your life? In this powerful teaching, Pastor David Blunt shares the key to thriving in 2025 and beyond: learning to listen to God.
Discover how to hear His voice, make better decisions, and live a life of purpose and spiritual growth. Through practical insights and biblical principles, Pastor Blunt teaches the importance of stillness, solitude, and being led by the Holy Spirit. Don’t let busyness rob you of God’s best for your life—start thriving today!
Plan your visit today to visit Church on the Rock in St. Peter’s, Missouri, located just 20 minutes away from St. Louis. cotr.org/planyourvisit

item.title: The Power Of Generosity - Part 2 - How to Find True Happiness in an Unhappy World
item.itunes:title: The Power Of Generosity - Part 2 - How to Find True Happiness in an Unhappy World
item.itunes:summary:
In a world filled with challenges and negativity, finding lasting happiness can seem impossible. But what if the key to true joy lies in something as simple as generosity? In this message, Pastor Blunt shares life-changing insights from the Bible about how generosity impacts not only others but also transforms our own hearts.
Watch now to learn how living generously can help you experience true happiness, no matter what’s going on around you. Don’t miss this powerful continuation of The Power of Generosity series!
Plan your visit today to visit Church on the Rock in St. Peter’s, Missouri, located just 20 minutes away from St. Louis. cotr.org/planyourvisit

item.title: Guest Speaker: Bob Harrison
item.itunes:title: Guest Speaker: Bob Harrison
item.itunes:summary:
Have you ever wondered how to attract more blessings and goodness into your life? In this powerful message, Bob Harrison, also known as "Dr. Increase," shares his insights on the incredible power of God's favor and how to activate it in your daily life.
Join us as Bob, a successful businessman and Kingdom builder, reveals his personal experiences and practical steps to increase favor in every area of your life.
Watch now and discover how to unlock the supernatural favor of God!
Plan your visit today to visit Church on the Rock in St. Peter’s, Missouri, located just 20 minutes away from St. Louis. cotr.org/planyourvisit

item.title: How To Deal With Difficult People - Part 2 - Responding to Difficult People: 5 Biblical Strategies for Grace and Wisdom
item.itunes:title: How To Deal With Difficult People - Part 2 - Responding to Difficult People: 5 Biblical Strategies for Grace and Wisdom
item.itunes:summary:
For many, the thought of dealing with a difficult person-whether at work, school, or even within the family-can bring feelings of anxiety and dread. But what does the Word of God say about how we should handle such challenges? While we can't control other people's personalities, we can control how we respond. In this message, Daniel Blunt shares five practical ways we can, with the guidance of the Holy Spirit, respond with grace and wisdom when faced with difficult people.
Plan your visit today to visit Church on the Rock in St. Peter’s, Missouri, located just 20 minutes away from St. Louis. cotr.org/planyourvisit.
item.description:

item.title: Do We Confront or Ignore Difficult People? - How To Deal With Difficult People - Part 1
item.itunes:title: Do We Confront or Ignore Difficult People? - How To Deal With Difficult People - Part 1
item.itunes:summary:
At one point or another we all have deal with difficult people. Do we confront or ignore difficult people? How do I treat people who mistreat me? What does the Bible say about difficult people? Pastor Blunt answers these questions in his new collection of talks, How to Deal with Difficult People. This collection is designed to help strengthen your endurance and resilience to foster your spiritual and emotional growth to be able to deal with difficult people. Watch part 1 to discover 7 strategies for dealing with these type of people.
Plan your visit today to visit Church on the Rock in St. Peter’s, Missouri, located just 20 minutes away from St. Louis. cotr.org/planyourvisit.

item.title: How Can We Change the World? - How To Increase Your Influence - Part 4
item.itunes:title: How Can We Change the World? - How To Increase Your Influence - Part 4
item.itunes:summary:
We can change the world with kindness. With everything happening in our world, it's clear that kindness has been declining over the years. It's time to show more kindness! As we have been learning from the Bible, we are to be the salt and light of the world. But how can we be salt and light? Through the ministry of good works! Good works are the key to influence, promotion, and fulfilling our destiny.
In the last installment of "How to Increase You're Influence", Pastor Blunt teaches us how we can use our good works, to influence and impact others! Watch today's teaching to learn and grow to increase your influence!
Plan your visit today to visit Church on the Rock in St. Peter’s, Missouri, located just 20 minutes away from St. Louis. cotr.org/planyourvisit.

item.title: Kindness Matters -How To Increase Your Influence - Part 3
item.itunes:title: Kindness Matters -How To Increase Your Influence - Part 3
item.itunes:summary:
Kindness matters when in comes to leading people to God. In Matthew 5, it says that you are the salt and light in the world. Through good works, we make God look good in heaven and impact those around us. In part 3 of the collection of talks, "How to Increase Your Influence," Pastor Blunt teaches us how kindness is a holy influence. Through good works, we lead people to God!
Plan your visit today to visit Church on the Rock in St. Peter’s, Missouri, located just 20 minutes away from St. Louis. cotr.org/planyourvisit.

item.title: Influence Through Good Works - How To Increase Your Influence - Part 2
item.itunes:title: Influence Through Good Works - How To Increase Your Influence - Part 2
item.itunes:summary:
In part 2 of the collection of talks, "How to Increase Our Influence," Pastor Blunt teaches us how to have self-leadership to be able to lead those around us and increase our influence. It’s through good works we can influence our world, and it all starts with those around us!
Plan your visit today to visit Church on the Rock in St. Peter’s, Missouri, located just 20 minutes away from St. Louis. cotr.org/planyourvisit.

item.title: Be an Influencer - How To Increase Your Influence - Part 1
item.itunes:title: Be an Influencer - How To Increase Your Influence - Part 1
item.itunes:summary:
We are not called to conform to the culture, but to influence the culture! Jesus had a reputation of doing good works. Through good works, we can change the culture, bring glory to God, and impact those around us. Watch this talk to learn how you can increase your influence.
Plan your visit today to visit Church on the Rock in St. Peter’s, Missouri, located just 20 minutes away from St. Louis. cotr.org/planyourvisit.

item.title: How Can I Change the Way I am Living - How To Succeed When Others Fail - Part 3
item.itunes:title: How Can I Change the Way I am Living - How To Succeed When Others Fail - Part 3
item.itunes:summary:
If you're at a point in your life where you had enough and want to change your thoughts, beliefs, actions, and reactions to life's pressures, this teaching is for you! Pastor Blunt explains how Matthew 7:24-26 has the direction we need to make the changes in our life to live a successful life.

item.title: How come some Christians succeed and others don’t? - How To Succeed When Others Fail - Part 1
item.itunes:title: How come some Christians succeed and others don’t? - How To Succeed When Others Fail - Part 1
item.itunes:summary:
Have you ever asked yourself, how do some Christians succeed while others don’t? In Pastor Blunt’s new collection of talks, How to Succeed When Others Fail, this question gets answered. The purpose of this teaching is to help your faith have a new momentum. A moentum that will draw you closer to God, grow in your faith and help you succeed as a believer!

item.itunes:author: Pastor David Blunt
item.author: webservant@cotr.org (Church On The Rock)

item.title: Failing Forward -Failure The BackDoor To Success - Part 2
item.itunes:title: Failing Forward -Failure The BackDoor To Success - Part 2
item.itunes:summary:
We all fail, don't let it defeat you instead when you fail, fail forward!
In part 2 of the collection of talks, "Failure: The Back Door to Success," Pastor Blunt gives a clear picture of how to reframe failure, teaching on the story of Moses and the 12 spies found in Numbers 13-14. They had a grasshopper complex instead of a giant-killer mindset!
Plan your visit today to visit Church on the Rock in St. Peter’s, Missouri, located just 20 minutes away from St. Louis. cotr.org

item.title: Reframing Failure - Failure The Back Door To Success - Part 1
item.itunes:title: Reframing Failure - Failure The Back Door To Success - Part 1
item.itunes:summary: Failure is a natural part of life. We all experience victories and setbacks. What truly matters is how we recover from those failures. In this series, Pastor Blunt teaches us how to reframe how we think about failure and overcome our fear of it. God can take our imperfections, shame, sins, and failures and use them to fulfill His purpose in our lives. Plan your visit today to visit Church on the Rock in St. Peter’s, Missouri, located just 20 minutes away from St. Louis. cotr.org

item.title: How Can I Discover My Purpose?
item.itunes:title: How Can I Discover My Purpose?
item.itunes:summary:
Discovering your purpose is a transformative journey that can lead to a happy, fulfilled, and influential life. Pastor Blunt outlines 7 ways to uncover our unique gifts, emphasizing that living out our purpose will have an eternal reward.
Plan your visit today to visit Church on the Rock in St. Peter’s, Missouri, located just 20 minutes away from St. Louis. cotr.org

item.title: Why am I here on earth for? - - Pathway to Promotion Part 3
item.itunes:title: Why am I here on earth for? - - Pathway to Promotion Part 3
item.itunes:summary:
In these series of talks, Pathway to Promotion, Pastor Blunt answers the question, why am I here on earth for? Learning what our identity, calling and gifting are gives us the recipe to know why we are here on earth for. When we know these 3 things, we live happier, productive, and are assets to those around us.
Plan your visit today to visit Church on the Rock in St. Peter’s, Missouri, located just 20 minutes away from St. Louis. cotr.org

item.title: You have a gift to fulfill your destiny - Pathway to Promotion Part 2
item.itunes:title: You have a gift to fulfill your destiny - Pathway to Promotion Part 2
item.itunes:summary:
You have a gift to fulfill your purpose and finish strong. In part 2 of Pathway to Promotion, Pastor David Blunt unpacked what your calling is and how you can find it. When you discover your gifts, then you know your calling, and with your calling, you discover your purpose and with purpose, God gives you grace!
Plan your visit today to visit Church on the Rock in St. Peter’s, Missouri, located just 20 minutes away from St. Louis. cotr.org
